title: When I click on a link, a whole new copy of the browser seems to open from the right side of the screen.
content:
When I click on a link, a whole new copy of the browser seems to open from the right side of the screen. This is disconcerting to say the least. More importantly I find it hard to go back and forth between windows to get something done.

This just started when I downloaded/installed a recent new version of Firefox. (Version 104.0.1)

How do I get rid of this "feature"? I mush prefer opening screens in the same browser copy.

title: Lost tab histroy on session restore
content:
I have "Open previous windows and tabs" checked, and normally all tabs are restored correctly. However, I often have a Youtube video or playlist open, with several videos already in the history for the tab.

Case 1: On restore, the video (single, non-playlist) loses any query parameters that were added (ex: setting a time on the Youtube video so that it will be at the same point upon restore, ex: "&t=2m55s"). These parameters are added by me and the tab is requested WITH the query parameters (enter is pressed) so that the parameters are present on window (Firefox) close for the next session.

Case 2: On restore, the playlist is often set back several (2-5) videos (urls/history entries).

Could be due to an add-on the interacts with Youtube called "Enhancer for Youtube", but I have found no option or issue with Enhancer that has caused this behaviour in other browsers (Chrome).

title: Use button6 and button7 mouse button on website
content:
I'm running firefox 104.0b10 as expanded tarball on xubuntu 20.04 .

When I do:


var pressDetect = function (e){ alert(e.buttons); } document.addEventListener('mousedown', pressDetect, true)

It works for mouse buttons 1-3. It doesn't work for buttons 4-5 but that's already explained in the manual: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/buttons#firefox_notes

However, it doesn't seem to work for buttons 6-9 too. Is that a bug somewhere or am I missing anything?

Buttons are detected by linux, btw:

$ xev -event button | grep button 

   state 0x10, button 11, same_screen YES    state 0x10, button 11, same_screen YES    state 0x10, button 10, same_screen YES    state 0x10, button 10, same_screen YES

What's wrong? Did I do something wrong?

title: Import passwords from Brave not working
content:
I'm moving from Brave to Firefox Developer, and trying to import all data from Brave... especially passwords.

When I import from Safari, Chrome, MS Edge I get a Mac dialogue box asking for my Mac password, and then all the data is imported correctly.

When I try the same with Brave, there is no Mac dialogue box, and the import process just says it was successful - but no passwords are imported at all.

I didn't find any settings in Brave saying that I had to allow password export or anything like that.

Is this a bug? and is there a workaround? (because I really don't want to have to input all those passwords for so many sites since moving to Brave!)

creator: John.Miezitis

title: Web Application breaks because of Total Cookie Protection
content:
We have a very old web application which requires JSESSION_ID to be stored in cookies for our login session. As part of our solution, we provide a HTML document in which we embed the URLs of our web application. This HTML document can be opened locally, but, it tries to contact our application for Login validation. As part of that it needs to access the JSESSION_ID.

Before Total Cookie Protection was made default, the application was working fine. But, after making it default, we are observing 2 behaviors which are breaking our application. Those 2 behaviors are: 1. When we click on a button to open the document, nothing happens. We checked the console logs and the network tab in the Browser developer tool, but we couldn't find anything. 2. Sometimes, browser is sending wrong JSESSSION_ID. Here also, we couldn't find anything in browser developer tool.

Once, we disable Total Cookie Protection both the above problems goes away. We checked Firefox's documentationÂ : https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Storage_Access_API) and we found that our application has un-partitioned storage to cookie jars.

We are looking for pointers on how to fix this problem. Thank you.
creator: karthikeyahs

title: How to automatically configure custom extension in Mozilla Firefox 91.4.0esr.
content:
Hello all,

I've been trying to automatically configure the Firefox to start with the custom extension, but with no success. The extension is working if I select the manifest.json from the about:debugging temporary add button. Or when I try to upload the xpi file from my computer. The environment that I'm currently working on is Linux with RedHat distribution 7.9.

I have he following configuration directories:

  • Bulleted list item /usr/lib64/firefox/defaults/pref/autoconfig.js which contains the following properties(pref("toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets", true);

pref("general.config.obscure_value", 0); pref("general.config.filename", "firefox.cfg");

  • Bulleted list item /usr/lib64/firefox/firefox.cfg which contains the following properties:

pref("extensions.autoDisableScopes", 0); pref("extensions.enabledScopes", 15);

The custom extensions is packed in an .xpi file which is located in /home/<user>/.mozilla/extensions/preventrightclick/preventrightclick.xpi

The content of the preventrightclick.xpi is in the images below. I've tried multiple locations for this xpi in order to be automatically installed, such as: /usr/share/mozilla/extensions/preventrightclick/preventrightclick.xpi /home/<user>/.mozilla/firefox/<profileId>/extensions/preventrightclick.xpi Nothing worked, strange is that the extensions can be installed manually.

If you have any clues, or what could I try, please let me know. Thanks!
creator: alexmicle89

title: With multiple instances, how to use shortcut to open new window.
content:
Thank you for your patience on this particular matter. Any solutions?

Short ver. of the problem: with a designated profile, I cannot launch a new window of an already running firefox using shortcut. Error msg "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. ...". I have to first active the firefox window and then use Ctrl+N, which is very annoying considering someone has to open/close many new windows a day.

Details: Here is my environment: in windows 10, say, I have three copies of firefox programs with their own profiles for different purposes. Something like this: D:\Firefox 1, this is the firefox program itself. D:\Firefox 2 D:\Firefox 3 D:\Profiles\1, this is the profile folder named as "1" D:\Profiles\2 D:\Profiles\3

I then use shortcut to launch each firefox, creating a shortcut then add options in the target line. Like this: D:\Firefox 1\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\1 D:\Firefox 2\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\2 D:\Firefox 3\firefox.exe -no-remote -profile D:\Profiles\3

I then use autohotkey to designate a particular hotkey to each firefox. Like this: Alt+1, launch firefox 1 Alt+2, launch firefox 2 Alt+3, launch firefox 3

The overall goal is to have complete separate operations.

The issue, I first use alt+1 or double click the shortcut with launch options to launch a firefox. Then, if I need to open another window of an already running firefox, which is minimized to the taskbar, I have to first activate the firefox window and then click ctrl+n. If I use the Alt+1 or double click the shortcut with launch options, an error msg pops saying, "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. ..." The ideal behavior is to use shortcut to launch a new window.

Thank you guys!
creator: moneykor
